inn1.comm: nips back of a length, tucked into the leg side and he's off the mark as well
full outside off, left alone
on leg stump, takes the pad into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, defended to the covers
strangled appeal for lbw as he whips across the line of a length ball, but not very excited...inside edge
nice looking drive, full outside off and he comes onto the front to drive to cover
pulls the length back, keeps it outside off, defended to the off side
that's a beauty, draws Moeen onto the front foot and beats the edge with a hint of swing
punchy back-foot drive from Moeen, short-of-a-length ball outside off and he stood tall to place it through the covers
full outside off, hint of shape back into Lumb as he shoulders arms
first boundary of the day, a full, wide delivery is square driven past point and with the timing to compensate for a sluggish outfield
pushed across outside off, left alone...not miles away from a wide
beats the edge again, swings away from Moeen and lulls him into pushing at it away from his body
full on off stump, pushed firmly back to Bravo in his follow through
and he works it through the leg side, a length ball that he pushes straight of mid-on...gives Samuels a chase to test out that groin
comes forward, gets a thick inside edge into his pads which then rebounds to the off side
onto the front foot again, defends square into the off side
short outside off, poor delivery on this surface, Moeen drives it off the back foot through the covers although doesn't get perfect timing
very wide outside off, and called so by the umpire
picks the gap through the off side again, there's a sweeper on the cover boundary
terrific shot, full outside and he picks it up over straight midwicket with a strong bottom. Good intent by Lumb
full outside off, Lumb shuffles right across his crease and then leaves alone
he's timing them nicely at the moment, full outside off and he drives this sweetly wide of mid-off to his right
left alone outside off
and now Moeen flays one through the off side, threw his arms into the wide delivery but it went straight to the cover sweeper
back of a length outside, left alone
fuller this time, keeps it outside off, Lumb lets another one through to the keeper
tucked off middle stump into the leg side, goes fine of deep square-leg
aims to drive into the off side, loses his shape a touch and gets a thick bottom edge which dribbles just off the cut strip
oh, that's a superb piece of timing. An elegant back-foot drive to a short of a length delivery, no big follow-through this time. Just a punch. Not easy on a slow pitch
quite short outside off, Lumb decides to leave and Ramdin takes at waist height
wide outside off, Lumb tries to fetch it and pull through the leg side and doesn't really get very close to making contact
defended square into the off side
good piece of fielding to prevent another likely boundary, Simmons diving at cover to cut off Lumb's front foot cut
walks across onto off stump, tries to pull a delivery that isn't that short and gets a bottom edge into his thigh
short of a length, opens the face and runs it down to third man
short of a length, plays a short-arm pull out to deep square-leg
picks out deep square with another pull...too much short stuff so far
short outside off, he drops his hands instead of pulling this time
breakthrough! Loose from Lumb. It was short and fairly wide, he didn't not seem fully committed to the cut shot and almost guided it to the right of backward point where a sharp catch is held

first ball! And it's a short ball. Stokes went for the pull, perhaps it wasn't as short as he thought, it comes off a big top edge and loops to Rampaul who takes a few steps around from short fine-leg
full on off stump, solidly defended
outside leg stump, called a wide
nicely placed, on leg stump again and he glances it fine with a flick of the wrists. Just has the pace on it to beat deep square running around
presses forward and gets a thick, but controlled, outside edge to third man
opens the face and drives this behind point down to third man
works this from around off stump into the leg side

blimey! This one has take off from a length and strikes Root a painful blow on the bottom hand. Takes his glove off straight away and the physio comes out. Might be the thumb that has taken the brunt.
full on middle and leg, worked out to midwicket and he then shakes his hand...not happy
short on off stump, pulled out to deep square
worked through the leg side
nice drive, leans into a full ball and places it wide of mid-off
short, Root latches on with a square cut which goes straight to point but then gets a run anyway when the throw ricochets off the non-strike's stumps
full outside off, defended to cover
keeps a touch low on off stump as he defends on the back foot...takes his bottom hand off the bat in pain
short outside off, driven from the back foot to cover
punched out to cover
full outside off, left alone
back of a length and sliding down the leg side, Moeen chips it aerially off his hips through a vacant square leg
in the channel, holds its line on a length, steps out and shoulders arms
touch short and zips through wide of the stumps as Root awkwardly throws a horizontal bat at it... called wide
comes forward, again raises the bat as a length delivery passes through outside off
drops short and at the body, Moeen scoops it away through midwicket, not totally in control but safe enough for a couple into the deep
angled across from over the wicket, comes forward to defend
slightly wide of the stumps, opens the face and runs a single through backward point
military medium, 75mph from Sammy, in the channel and steered down to third man for one more
on the stumps, worked behind square on the leg side
pitched up on off stump, closes the face and works one to midwicket
pushed across, off-stump line, tapped defensively into the covers
sticks in the pitch a little as Moeen drives on the up, slightly aerial through mid-on but wide of the bowler, single down the ground
excellent timing and placement from Root, opens the face of the bat and runs a length ball wide of third man, using what pace was on offer and it reaches the fence untroubled
pitched up, bit more grunt from Smith, nearly 80mph, Root drives and gets an inside edge on to his front pad
comes forward, glides one more down to third man
full and around off stump, Moeen can't pierce the cover field on the drive
short and around off stump, neatly cushioned square on the off side and they scamper a single
goes round the wicket, Moeen walks across his stumps and fiddles a couple through square leg
in the channel outside off, opens the face for a single behind point
tighter line from Sammy, not quite full enough to drive, blocked on off
angled in with the arm, turned to the fielder stationed at midwicket
length ball, jumps a little more than Root expected, hits the glove and drops short on the off side as he plays across the line
tossed up outside off, regular offbreak and Moeen lets it go
floated up, full and slow around off stump, meets it at the pitch and drives on through the covers
length around off, skids on and Root jabs down in it
definite turn for Narine, plenty of revs on the ball as it spins back in, Root blocks into the ground towards slip
touch shorter, runs the ball in front of square for a single
skidding on a little quicker, possibly a carrom ball, defended into the off side
length ball on the stumps, Root heave-hos across the line, mishitting a single through midwicket off his bottom edge
dug in short and Mooen ramps the ball neatly over backward point for a couple, controlled shot though the cover sweeper comes round to prevent four
round the wicket and on the pads, flicked behind square for one
on the front foot, nudges a single back down the ground
Ramdin is up to the stumps again, this flicks the pad down the leg side, maybe a tickle of bat too, they run well for a couple more
length ball, spinning in from outside off, comes forward to defend
tossed up on the stumps, worked through the leg side from the crease
drops this short, gentle turn away from the left-handed Moeen, who stands upright and punches through cover
neatly played, on the back foot and nurdling the ball very fine, open bat face and steered wide of slip for a couple
on the stumps, picks a gap at midwicket
a jaffa from Narine, beats everything! Pitched on off and held its line, Moeen played around it, missed the inside edge and must have bounced an inch over the stumps, at most
round the wicket, tapped through square leg by Root
goes over the wicket, comes forward and defends
tossed up outside off stump, goes down on one knee to sweep hard and flat but straight at backward square
lovely stroke from Moeen, lifts the sense of torpor that was just beginning to set in, Miller was a little short and wide and this was threaded through point for a welcome boundary
defended into the leg side
tossed up on the stumps and swept, again can't beat the man
tossed up and worked behind square leg with the turn
played into the off side from the crease
squirts off the outside edge, to the excitement of Narine, through backward point for a single
Narine should be even more excited this time, as a doosra does Root, only for Ramdin to drop it! Tough chance, as it deviated just enough to make shire it wouldn't go straight into the hands

big appeal from Narine for lbw, Root playing down the wrong line, Erasmus thinks about it before shaking his head but West Indies review after a short discussion. Looks like a good shout, it straightened on middle and leg, struck on the knee roll... but Hawk-Eye has it going over the top! So, no dice for Narine, the review used up, too
floated up outside off, defended into the covers
tossed up around off, driven into the ground back to the bowler
flighted, again Moeen comes forward and punches past the bowler for a single to long-on
driven into the off side coming forwards
comes forward and dabs a single through point
now a missed stumping from Ramdin! Called a wide, the delivery down the leg side, but the ball clanged out of iron gloves with Moeen scrambling back to regain his ground
tossed up on the stumps, clips one safely off his pads this time
nicely played again from Root, lissome wrists steering through point, though a misfield from Rampaul contributed to them running three
drags this short, Root drops back and pulls in ungainly fashion through mid-on
round the wicket, tossed up and punched back down the ground
nudged into the leg side
full and on the stumps, gets down and paddles a single through square - polite applause for the England hundred
slides on with the arm, muted appeal for lbw
tossed up and this time Moeen climbs into it, power to go alongside his grace, launching a slog-sweep over deep midwicket - that's a decent way to bring up your first international half-century
pushed through and misses with a sweep
gives this some air outside off, can't beat cover on the drive
goes across and plays square from the crease
very full and swept crisply through backward square, that will be a boundary, well placed by Root
slightly quicker, on off stump, Root pushes back to the bowler
floated up around off, prods defensively into the leg side
short from Samuels, sits up for Moeen to pull flat through midwicket to the boundary rider
full, sliding down the leg side, closes the face for one behind square
goes back and the ball straightens a touch, hits the pad as he works across the line
again skids on with the arm, hit on the front pad trying to sweep, outside the line
floated up quite wide, draws a loose waft from Moeen, who doesn't get a touch on it as Ramdin collects
flat and darted outside off, uses the feet and tickles a single through the covers
tossed up and worked with the spin through midwicket, into a gap for a couple
full and flighted, pushed back down the track

touch more air, drives off the inside half of the bat - straight back to the bowler! Miller makes lite work of the catch, a dolly, really, and Moeen has tossed away a big score, having looked very comfortable. Maybe just did his a touch in the flight... ends a stand worth 78
full, around off stump, worked with a turn of the wrists to short midwicket
very full and Morgan straight away reverses the hands, hits it into the ground straight at slip, who can only palm it away, single to get Morgan going
round the wicket, angled in and tapped back on the off side

bowled him, Morgan done by the doosra! Narine strikes, a little bit of magic to get rid of England's conjurer... This was slightly short of a length, straightening on off stump and it skipped on, beat Morgan on the inside and lopped the off bail - the same ball that nearly did for Moeen a few overs ago. Super ball to the new batsman
floated up and Buttler gets on the front foot to defend calmly enough
zips one past the outside edge into Ramdin's hands as the batsman plays back
on the stumps this time, another doosra I think, Buttler defends on the back foot
quicker carrom ball outside off, steered to short third man
goes back and opens the face, again can't get the ball past the ring
down the leg side, Root attempts a paddle, sends it bobbling towards short fine leg, he amble the run somewhat and a direct hit would have done for him at the other end
floated up and defended around off
nicely flighted from Miller, presses forward in defence again
gets on the front foot and drives wide of mid-off, slightly set back, they get one
goes back and across, Root runs the ball to backward point for one more
tossed up and driven into the covers, it's a bump ball but the crowd cheers the catch, Buttler just shakes his head
tossed up on the stumps, Root taps one down the ground
outside off, plays a cut shot off the back foot but fails to connect
comes forward to defend
slides on down the leg side, turns it into the ground wide of leg slip for a couple
Buttler doesn't pick the doosra, gets a leading edge as he tries to turn to leg, the fielder in the covers is sleeping though and they scamper one
Root is playing Narine reasonably well, comes forward and pushes one more down the ground
on the stumps, worked through a vacant region at midwicket
on the front foot, dabs another single down the ground
tossed up around middle and off, straightening and defended back to the bowler
again defended around off stump
floated up, gets a big stride in and softly defends into the covers, time enough for a quick single
Buttler sweeps, plays it well and keeps it down towards fine leg for a welcome boundary
on the stumps, Root tries to sweep but only gloves it on to his back leg
on the sweep again, picks out the fielder this time
angled in towards middle and leg, pushed down the ground
comes forward, another single to long-on
darted towards middle and leg, Root sweeps hard but straight to backward square leg
Samuels drags his length down, this time Root stands upright and punches to long-on
length ball, sliding to the leg side, worked through square leg for one
floated up on the stumps, driven back down the track to the bowler
dabbed through square on the leg side
outside the line of off, comes forward and steers in front of point, the fielder is quickly on it but they get one
there's the power from Buttler, sitting back and playing a wristy drive from the crease, muscles it through the covers and there's no protection, four
tossed up, straightening on leg stump, Buttler blocks from the crease
on the stumps, turned to leg
full and dobbled back to the bowler, it bounces over Samuels' hand and then deceives mid-off, gifting a couple to Root
flat and off middle stump, swept adroitly through backward square, more good timing and placement from Root and this races away - up goes the bat for his half-century
angled in towards middle and off, tapped to leg
tossed up, slightly short and Root waits, works one more down the ground
deftly steered fine for a couple, Buttler opening the face and running the ball past the keeper
flat trajectory on middle and off, defended on the front foot
pushed down the ground to long-on
drops back, the delivery was a touch short and Buttler picks up another boundary with a wristy cut through backward point
tossed up, fuller and straighter, leans out to defend
works this off the pads to midwicket
again flighted on the stumps, little slower, Buttler shows it a solid forward defensive
gentle offbreak outside the line of off, Root reverse the hands and fillets a couple past short third man, nicely done
tossed up and worked through midwikcet with a roll of the wrists
length ball, bit of extra turn and bounce and Buttler is struck on the thigh trying to play across the line
slightly shorter, Buttler plays to long-on from back in the crease
pushed through outside off, goes back and steers one through square on the off side

plays a late cut, possibly cramped for room, Ramdin celebrates immediately, throwing the ball into the air... Samuels was pretty non-committal and Erasmus looks totally uninterested before raising his finger almost as an afterthought. Buttler, is flabbergasted and calls for the review. This is going to be difficult, the ball went past the bat very close to the keeper, the angle prevents a clear view of it... There's no Hot Spot, so they're going on audio and visuals, which seem inconclusive. However, the third umpire, Rod Tucker, decides that Buttler didn't hit it, so Erasmus has his decision overturned
down the leg side, Root sweeps but can't get it away
tossed up and swept behind square leg this time for one
goes back and attempts to cut, can't get it away
driven down the ground for one
sweeps again, to the right of short fine leg
Buttler plays the sweep too, gets hit on the glove and it bobbles fine of the short fine leg fielder
digs this in short, testing Buttler on the bouncer again, hooks down through square leg
slower ball from Bravo, rolls the fingers over it, Root picks it and drives through the covers for a couple
very full on off stump, covers the line and defends with a straight bat
gets forward, jams the ball defensively into the covers
good length, on the stumps, works a single to long-on
drops short, shoulder height down the leg side, rolls the wrists on a pull to deep backward square
tucked into midwicket
flicked out through square leg
full outside off, pushed down the ground to long off
comes forward and drives to cover
gets his head over the line and works down the ground
goes deep into the crease and nudges through midwicket
a loopy slower ball outside off, too wide
full outside off, whipped down the ground with plenty of bottom hand
lovely batting, comes forward and picks the gap between cover and mid-off with a fine piece of timing
short this time, he rocks back this time and pulls through midwicket
short ball outside off, Buttler thought about pull but then drops his hands and bat
dabbed to backward point
comes forward, outside off, opens the face to third man
full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
gets a thick edge low past Buttler, Ramdin a little late and mistimed his dive
down to third man
works from off stump down the ground to long-on
another short ball and he connects well with a pull which goes behind square, two bounces over the boundary
full outside off, flicks down the ground to long on
full delivery, Root comes forward and pushes to the off side
sharp spin into Root as he goes onto the back foot but that looked to have done too much
this one spins away and beats the attempt to cut it fine
slips down the leg side, perhaps an attempted quicker delivery
he's forward this time, it's back on off stump, pushes wide of cover
goes deep into the crease, the ball is slightly shorter, and worked to midwicket
back foot again, drives out through point to the sweeper
a strong flick off leg stump, travels a long way in the air but falls short of deep square-leg
not sure he wanted it quite so fine, but he'll take the boundary...shaping to cut a wide delivery, comes off a top edge and flies fine of short third man
pushed off the back foot, Rampaul dives in his follow through (or perhaps more of a fall). Root shakes his hand again, still hurting
a controlled glide down to third man who is now back on the boundary
brilliant from Buttler, walks across his stumps then scoops a short-of-a-length delivery over the keeper's head...this is very close to a six
full on leg stump, clipped off the pads to the left of short fine-leg
stretches well forward and drives to cover
brings out the reverse sweep, has to stretch a little as the ball spins towards leg but connects well to find deep cover
goes back, flicks out to deep midwicket
left alone outside off
rides a touch of extra bounce, worked behind square on the leg side
defends to the leg side
driven very firmly, looks set to beat mid-off, but Rampaul pulls off a smart dive
worked off the toes through the leg side
tucked down the ground to long from outside off...he scampers a second to bring up a well-earned fifty
starts to move to leg, but then stays in line with the stumps and flicks through midwicket
full delivery, flicked strongly through midwicket
angled into the pads, this is well placed behind square and the second can't be stopped...brings up the hundred stand, a very well-paced effort from this pair
worked off the stumps and placed between long-on and deep midwicket
dragged down short, pulled out to deep midwicket
a punchy drive out to deep cover
a well-placed cut goes through short third man
back-to-back boundaries, pulls a long hop through square leg...rolled his wrists, had so much time to play that shot
opens the face into the off side
length ball on the pads, Root closes the bat face and works a couple in front of square leg
goes back in the crease, turns the wrists and nudges a single into a gap at midwicket
length ball, Buttler opens up the shoulders and swats out towards deep midwicket, doesn't quite get hold of it, couple to the sweeper
pitched up on the stumps, clears the front leg and belabours down the ground, slightly underneath it but bounces safely towards long-on
on the stumps, rolls the wrists on a gentle pull through square
now Buttler gets it out of the middle, down on one knee to mow the ball over long-on, the fielder gamely stretches an arm up on the jump but it's a good 10-12 feet over the rope - the Buttler serves
slighlty short and wide, drops back and runs one fine
length ball skipping on outside off, comes forward and nudges into the covers
tossed up on off stump, Root uses his feet and nurdles a couple out between long-on and deep midwicket
sits in the crease, the ball skips on and Root guides it behind point for one
length, turned to leg from the crease
tossed up, spinning in from outside off, Buttler defends watchfully off the back foot
slower ball, wide of the stumps, chopped through point with a cross bat
full and straight, does well to slam the bat down in time
another slower ball, outside off and Buttler swings and misses
gets on the front foot, pushes into a gap in the covers - that's the 250, a ripple of applause round the ground

takes the pace off, Root comes forward outside off, waits and steers in front of point... there's a single, one more to take Root to his maiden ODI hundred. Yeah lets out a roar, punches the air, kisses the helmet. Generously received right round the ground
pitched up on the stumps, Buttler clubs the ball viciously down the ground, just one thoough
clears the ropes again! Strong bottom hand comes through as Narine tossed one up on the stumps, Buttler thumped it back down the ground and over long-on once more
full and outside off, Buttler reverses the hands and sweeps one wide of backward point
spinning in from outside off, paddled through the leg side
beats the fielder this time, powerful reverse sweep from Buttler! Too full from Narine and it's soon skittering away to deep backward point
comes forward and pushes a single through the covers
no-ball called, as Root fails to connect with a reverse sweep, it bobbles away off the body

another Dorothy, huuuuuuge blow from Buttler! Narine dropped short, the ball sat up and was carted out towards deep midwicket, looked like it might have rather too much air but it sailed comfortable beyond the rope
pitched up, sliding to leg, gets a little tickle on it towards fine leg
on the stumps, up in the blockhole again, clubbed to midwicket, who gets enough on it to keep them to one
slightly full, outside off and Root swings airily, fails to connect
steps away and Bravo follows him with the yorker, squeezed to leg for just one - good bowling
he's nailed another, over deep backward square leg this time! Actually, this may actually have been a top edge, slightly wide and Buttler threw the plumbing at it, sliced it over the boundary rope
pitched up and punched back down the track to the bowler
length ball, spinning to leg, manages to fiddle it behind square
floated up outside off, opens the face and steers one towards point
top-edged but safe, went across his stumps and tried to sweep, the ball looped high but fine of the fielder on the ring
spinning down the leg side, Root misses out but not called wide
drops this short, worked into a midwicket gap on the back foot
pushed through a little quicker, pushed through midwicket for one more
full and straight and smeared down the ground, a mishit, leading edge possible, but it sails towards long-off, there's no one there and it plops safely earth
backs away, Bravo spots it and Buttler can only drag one to midwicket

tries to get cheeky with a reverse-lob and picks out short third man - Root toots his last! It was a sparkling, busy innings, has really set England up with their second-best fifth-wicket stand in ODIs. Bravo took the pace off and the attempt to loft it over the man on the edge of the circle didn't quite come off
very full, outside off, pushes into a gap to get off the mark
pitched up full and straight again, nudges off his pads through midwicket

boundary for Bopara, a wristy flick over midwicket, low full toss from Bravo and it was met with an rubbery check-drive - Bopara's only mini-helicopter - super timing and England are on the brink of 300
full and in the blockhole, squirted down the ground
follows Bopara as he steps to leg, Rampaul digs it in short and beats the outside edge as Bopara attempts to go inside out
slower-ball bouncer, down the leg side, Bopara watches it by and then Buttler calls him through, they have to dive at both ends

another slower ball - and Buttler has chipped it straight up into the air, he's out for 99! Holy moly, what a way to go, one short of his maiden ODI century... Rampaul followed him down the leg side, took the pace off and Buttler got a leading edge trying to hit through midwicket, the bowler made no mistake underneath it. Off slopes Jos Buttler, thorougly dejected, despite a superb knock
short and down the leg side, Bopara fails to connect with a pull and it rolls behind square
short and slightly leg side again, Bresnan rolls the wrists on a pull to fine leg

another slower ball, legcutter, and Bopara swings and misses, it rolls short off the thigh pad for a leg bye to end the innings - an excellent final over from Rampaul, then, though England will be plenty happy with defending 303

inn2.comm: starts round the wicket, flat and on off stump, the left-handed Powell punches to long-off
tossed up on leg stump and thwacked over square leg for a boundary first ball, clean swing of the arms through that stroke
similar line, similar result, Smith starting as he means to go on. The ball is coming on to the bat here and Smith scoops another four over square leg
shortens his length, Smith nudges this down the ground for one
tossed up on off stump, straightens, tapped to mid-on

bowled him, misses with the slog-sweep! Root has a wicket to go with his hundred, he looks just a delighted, if not more so, running off with his arms outstretched... This skidded on with the arm, ungainly swipe from Powell and the castle was breached

dug in short, Smith hooks flamboyantly... and picks out deep backward square leg! Two in two balls, brainless from Smith, really, with his partner having just fallen. It was back of a length, sat up to be pulled but he got under it as he swivelled, one leg in the air, and picked out the fielder on the fence
good pace and bounce from Broad, 85-86mph in the channel, left alone
goes across, defends on the back foot outside off
pitched up outside off, gets forward and leaves
back of a length and at the batsman, Simmons shows Smith how it should be done, powerfully pulling down to the fine-leg boundary
short of a length, outside the line of off, left alone
gets on the front foot and defends
length ball, outside off, Bravo drops back and chops behind square on the leg side via his inside edge
lovely stroke from Simmons, shows he's in good touch, leans out and drives fine of mid-off, whose dives is of the futile variety
length, on the stumps, chipped into the leg side but it lands safely
angled in with the arm, Bravo presses forward in defence
tossed up and punched down the ground to long-off
length delivery, leg-stump line, defended
fired across, slightly back of a length, Bravo defends calmly outside off
up towards 87mph from Broad, worked off the pads and rolling slowly towards square leg
gets across his stumps to cover the line in defence
bit of width and Bravo rasps the ball behind the diving Morgan at backward point, played the drive with an open face, down in the ground and skittering away for four
short of a length and much straighter from Broad, watchfully blocked
slightly short of a length, goes back and pushes one wide of mid-off
tossed up around the line of off, played to short extra cover off the front foot
tossed up, slightly too full and juicy and Bravo lasers a drive through the covers this time, another classy stroke
pushed through around off stump, dabbed into the off side coming forwards
shorter length, punched into the covers off the back foot
just a tickle sends this fine on the leg side, Root's line having drifted
pitched up outside off, asking to be driven, the bat turns in Simmons' hands and the ball flies towards point, dropping a yard or so short
goes back and across to defend
middle and off stump, closes the face and works to short midwicket
short-of-a-length ball around the line of off, lines it up in watchful defence
nicely played, Broad a touch fuller and Simmons punches one back on the leg side
hold-the-poise, Lara-esque cover drive from Bravo, that disappeared to the boundary in a puff of smoke - glorious stroke
floaty offbreak, quite wide of the stumps and Simmons gives this some treatment through the covers, nearly hits the cover off it
looped up around off, comes forward and drives one down the ground
leg side but straightening, closes the bat face and turns to square leg
full and flighted on middle and leg, nudged short to the on side
floated up on the stumps, glanced behind square, can't beat short fine leg

skips out and nails a crashing shot across the line... but Bopara has plucked it nonchalantly above his head at short midwicket! Moeen also picks up a wicket in his first over, Bravo gone in a puff of smoke thanks to some magic from Bopara
slings a short one down the leg side
length ball over the top of off stump, Simmons meets it on the up, pushed into the covers
back of a length, again pushed short into the off side

goes back and is beaten, playing inside the line... but Broad is stone-cold certain this is out, Buttler too, throwing the ball up in celebration. Broad implores Joel Wilson for the decision and, when it doesn't come, immediately reviews. There's no Hot Spot, remember, and it must have only been a feather, as the ball did not seem to deviate, to the naked eye... Actually, on slo-mo, it appears to straighten a touch, not sure if off the bat or the thigh pad, as it goes through. Rocking and rolling the replay, too close to call... and umpire Wilson eventually signals that the on-field decision has been upheld. Correctly, I think
short of a length and worked off the body, beats short midwicket but square leg has raced forward to cover it
goes across and defends outside the line of off

no doubt about this, Simmons has dragged on! The line was outside off, not giving Simmons anything, he tried to pull when it wasn't all that short, maybe ducked back a little off the surface and a clunking bottom edge ricocheted down into the woodwork
looped up and straightening outside off, tapped short towards cover
pushed back to the bowler coming forwards
skidding on and played late, cut into the ground towards point from right in front of off stump
tight line on off stump, Samuels drops back and drives into the ground
flighted, towards leg stump and straightening, blocked from the crease
flighted, outside the line of off, Samuels drives firmly but straight to cover point - no wicket for Parry but he does start with a maiden

Ramdin is beaten in identical fashion to Simmons, again Broad is adamant there was contact, he's jumping and waving his arms but umpire Wilson is unmoved... Replays just a inconclusive as the first, as Ramdin fenced outside off. In fact, I thought I was watching the Simmons one again, initially!
pitched up and Ramdin drives, slightly wild execution and a thick edge squirts in front of backward point
outside the line of off, Samuels shuffles across and steers towards point
lets this one go in the channel outside off
length, on off stump, shows it a straight bat in defence
slightly outside the line, Samuels drops back and glides a single behind point
tossed up and tickled back towards long-off for a single
full and drifting down the leg side, flicked behind square for another quick single
uses the feet, Parry drags it down a touch but Samuels is still able to punch one to long-off
floated up, plenty of air and driven back, Parry is down to reach it but it squirms out of his hands and Ramdin gets another single
and Samuels pushes straight to the close fielder on the off side
bit of flight and dip outside off, opens the face and runs the ball to backward point
pitched up full and straight, blocked towards mid-on
gets across to defend in front of the wicket
disciplined line from Bresnan, only around 80mph but hard to get away, Ramdin defends towards cover
angled in towards middle and off with the arm, a scrape of edge stifles Bresnan's lbw appeal as the ball rolls behind backward square
shorter length, around off, played back to the bowler
off-stump line, Samuels block towards midwicket with a turn of the wrists
tossed up and worked to leg, the fielder in the deep comes in to collect
bowling around the wicket, tossed up and punched to short extra cover
lovely shot from Samuels, a graceful loft down the ground, no sign of overexertion but it comfortably clears the rope
opens up the body again, this time drives along the ground to mid-off
pushed through a bit flatter and quicker, Samuels nudges one back past the bowler
drops back and plays a length ball towards mid-on
rapid bouncer from Bresnan, perhaps aided by the element of surprise and Samuels flinches out of the way
short again, this time doesn't get up as high and the batsman pulls through backward square leg
gets across and defends a length ball on the stumps
played off the back foot in front of point, might have been one but Samuels declines it
edged but just short of slip! Tredwell went low to his right, couldn't quite get his fingers underneath it, Ramdin was trying to pull out of the shot and it died quickly
goes back and across to defend
on the stumps, worked to leg
goes back to a shortish ball and taps one to long-on
Tredwell drops a little short again, cracked off the back foot but an excellent stop at cover prevents any runs
on the stumps, turned short on the leg side
sits in the crease, driven back to the bowler from in front of the stumps
angled across the right-hander, who this time manages to force the ball between cover and extra cover for a couple
sharp bouncer over off stump which beats Ramdin's pull
fuller delivery, nipping back, defended
full outside off, Ramdin comes forward and defends
reverts to a bouncer again, directed at the body, this time he connects with a hook which goes one bounce to long leg
back of a length outside off, defended to cover
driven off the back foot to cover
gets his foot onto off stump then works across the line to midwicket
full and driven back to the bowler
shorter delivery, he goes onto the back foot and forces it to midwicket
full on off stump, for a moment Ramdin was thinking of the slog-sweep but then pushed towards mid-off
flicked to midwicket
goes back in his crease and cuts a slightly shorter delivery to cover
touch of width offered up, Ramdin cuts firmly but it goes straight to point
fuller this time, outside off, defended to the covers
works this away from off stump out to deep square
drops in another sharp bouncer, beats Samuels comfortably as he goes for the pull
neatly punched off the back foot and bisects cover and mid-off
tries to force this through the off side, it's a touch shorter than the previous ball, he's not in quite as good position and it runs back to Bresnan
uses plenty of bottom hand as he works this miwicket
places it wide of midwicket this time...Ramdin has struggle to find the gaps so far
comes down the pitch, shapes for a lofted straight drive, and the ball skews off a thick outer part of the bat but doesn't carry to long-off
pushed down the ground to long-on
this time it comes out of the middle! Down the pitch again, picks the on side on this occasion and launches well into the stands
good response from Tredwell, slightly quicker and there's a hint of turn which cramps Samuels for room so he just defends
round the wicket, punched off the back foot down to long-on
driven square off the back foot through point
floated up fuller, Ramdin leans forward and defends
angled into leg stump, he works it off the pads to deep square

five down! Samuels has been given out caught behind cutting. Joel Wilson gives the decision on-field, but Samuels reviews. No massive edge or sound, but it was been given on-field, remember. Another interesting one for the third umpire. He now looks at the slow-mo. Quite similar to the Buttler review, earlier, which was overturned to a not out. This one is upheld! Samuels has to walk (slowly) off
driven off the back foot to cover
full toss outside off, driven to deep cover
back of a length, on off stump, defended
good short ball, Bravo isn't far from dragging this near his stumps as he tries to deflect it down to third man
flicked off the pads out to deep midwicket
down the leg side, that'll be an extra ball
almost plays too early at this length ball, pops the ball in the air but it's wide of Stokes
gorgeous stroke, a picture-perfect straight drive as Stokes goes full at the stumps
tries an expansive shot over the leg side but comes off a thick inside edge to deep square
slips this one down the leg side
full at middle, blocked
full at leg stump, dug out to the off side
flicked off the pads out to deep midwicket
tucks this off leg stump to deep square
comes forward and drives out to deep cover
full at middle and off, defended to cover
another nice piece of timing, this time he opens the face and places it square through the off side to give the sweeper some work
short of a length, on off stump, played to point
keeps it back of a length, defended up to mid-off
bouncer over middle and leg, loops over Bravo's back
pulls off one leg, splits the men in the deep at square leg and long leg
driven out to deep cover
strides forward and plays it back to Parry
defended towards the leg side, solid stuff again from Parry
drops this a touch short outside off but gets away with it as the cut goes to point
fuller delivery, whipped off the stumps to mid-on
dragged down short and this time it costs a boundary as he it gets pulled through square leg...a rare poor delivery
heaves a full delivery through the leg side, goes in the air bit wide of midwicket
a flamboyant drive to a full delivery on off stump but he picks out backward point
gets behind the line and defends
some width this time, Bravo leans back and drives out to deep cover
better ball, full on middle and off, pushed into the covers
touch of extra bounce this time, takes Ramdin by surprise and the lobs into space on the leg side off the splice
not far from a leading edge as he plays across the line of a full delivery, but gets it safely down to long-on
angled down the leg side, he goes for the sweep but just takes a glance off the pad past the keeper
back on off stump, driven down the ground
push and run into the off side
shorter outside off, again it doesn't cost anything as Ramdin finds point
worked off the pads out to deep midwicket
very full, almost a yorker, gets a thick inside edge into his boot
top edges a pull but it falls short of long leg as he runs off the boundary
thick outside edge to third man, it was full and wide, Bravo didn't hold back with his drive and the slip cordon is empty
short of a length, gets inside the length and tucks it off his body to deep square
full outside off, Ramdin doesn't really time his drive and finds cover
alternating between full and short, this is shorter and pulled through midwicket
short, angled down the leg side, pulled away fine
makes a sharp take as Ramdin misses his cut
low full toss, Ramdin whacks it onto his boot...he felt that
just short of a length, he goes for the pull and finds midwicket
that's a more powerful pull, picked up from outside off and rockets it through straight midwicket
back outside off stump, fuller, driven to backward point
round the wicket, on leg stump, tucked off the pads
on off stump, defended
comes forward and blocks to the off side
touch flatter this time, nothing expansive from Bravo as he defends
worked off the pads through square leg
clubbed down the ground but just another single...England won't mind them
full outside off, driven to deep cover
slower ball, might have been a legspinner, but loses the line down the leg side
Ravi strikes! Back of a length on off stump, Bravo trying to work it down to third man and the edge is very well held by Buttler up to the timber
slightly back of a length outside off, Sammy lets this through to the keeper
short again, this time Sammy frees the arms through a whip-crack pull but midwicket sprawls to stop it
brisk-ish 78mph, on off stump, Sammy shows it a straight bat
shuffles across and nudges a single back past the bowler to long-on
floated up and straightening on middle and off, defended pressing forwards
slightly short, sliding across the batsman, Sammy swings and misses
tossed up on the stumps, goes back and across to defend
length ball on off, pushed back to the bowler
lunges forward to defend, the ball rolls short on the leg side and they steal one
bit of extra flight, Ramdin gets solidly behind it in front of middle stump
comes forward and pushes one down the ground
length ball, bit of width but Ramdin cracks it to backward point from deep in the crease
slightly full, tailing in, leans on a drive but can't beat the man in the covers
full and tailing in towards middle and leg, whipped from in front of the pad through backward square
slower ball from Bopara, outside the line of off, Sammy props forward to defend
Sammy knows his way around some late-overs carnage, of course, and he times a crunching drive through the covers, albeit with the aid of a slightly tired dive from the fielder
tossed up and chopped into the ground, past the tumbling Tredwell for one down the ground
goes back, straightening outside leg, pushed to mid-on
length ball skidding on outside off, driven into the covers off the back foot
played back gently towards the bowler
on the stumps, pushed through, forcefully driven back along the ground to Tredwell, who fields
tossed up on the stumps and again Sammy covers up
he's got the diminutive Ramdin on strike to begin with, tossed up and he nudges one short into the leg side
pushed through flat and quick outside off, sits back and cracks the ball to point along the ground
tight on off, good length and holding its line, cuts into the ground this time
tossed up outside the line of off, pushes forward and dabs one into the covers
checks his drive and the ball nearly carries back to the bowler - Parry down on his knees, couldn't quite get his hands to it, the delivery just holding in the surface as Ramdin pushed forwards
works a single back through mid-on
good length outside off, shows it a straight bat and taps towards cover
Ramdin edges across in front of his stumps and swings from the hip, comes off the hip and bounces towards point
in the corridor outside off, comes across to block
dug in short and Ramdin sways under it - called wide on height
short and Ramdin is waiting, rocks back and rattles a pull shot to the midwicket boundary
pulls again, slightly squarer this time and the fielder runs round to keep them to one
goes back and glances one down to fine leg
slightly short and cut away for one
timed like a Rolex from Ramdin, skipping out and lofting down the ground, goes all the way... on the brink of fifty
tossed up outside off, very slow and loopy, makes room and carves the ball on the up past cover, that will be four more and fifty for Ramdin - only his fourth in 109 ODIs
now carts Parry over square leg, couple of bounces and there's no one stopping that - third boundary in a row
Parry is bowling over the wicket to Ramdin, who nudges one more to leg
skidding on outside off, Sammy rocks back and leathers a cut between point and short third man, bisects the two fielders and that will scurry away too - 20 off the over, Parry beginning to sizzle
nope, not quite succeeded! Ramdin now plays the tennis smash to a short ball, clears mid-on and is only a couple of bounces from the long-on boundary
fuller length, worked down the ground for one
SMASHED!! Sammy brutalises a flat six over cover point, a caveman swing of the arms sending a very modern missile into the advertising boards. The crowd loved that!
back of a length, gets in a bit of a tangle but scoops one behind square on the leg side
big lbw appeal from Broad as Ramdin is caught on the crease, played around it... but looked to be heading past leg stump
goes back in the crease and rides a short delivery, working to midwicket
length ball on the stumps, nudged through backward square for a couple
goes back, slightly full and poked in front of square on the off side for one more
Bresnan goes short, Sammy swings blindly and isn't far from playing on to his stumps
another bumper, top-edged into the sky this time, Broad comes dashing in from deep square but can't get there, despite throwing himself full length
super shot, advancing down the track and flicking four over midwicket, all in the wrists - think he picked the slower ball
full, fast and straight, defended this time
floated up on middle and leg, tapped to midwicket
down the leg side, might have been called wide but for a tickle of Sammy's pad strap, there's enough pace on it to get four
on leg stump, flicked short on the leg side
angled across the batsman, who sits deep and windmills the arms through a cut, picks out point
Sammy advances, beaten in the flight but Buttler misses the stumping opportunity! Grasping at thin air as the ball bounced through, Parry does well to prevent it reaching the boundary this time
tossed up and nudged into the leg side, "No!" is the call
bit of width, Sammy breezily hacks away, gets a big top edge but it bounces into Tredwell's midriff down at third man
fullish and around off, blocked from the crease
slightly full and again on off, Ramdin pushes tentatively towards point
nibbles back in off a length and hits Ramdin on the thigh pad as he swings across the line
goes across and pushes a length ball back past the bowler

Sammy explodes, England rejoice! Stokes claims an excellent running catch, above his head at deep backward square, he had to get round the rope whilst making sure to stay inside it, as Sammy took on the Bresnan bumper again - initially looked like it would go all the way but wasn't quite out of the screws, dipping in front of the stands and Stokes made it look easy
length, worked off the pads to midwicket
shorter and outside off, Miller drops back and defends his first ball
bit of extra bounce, takes the shoulder of the bat, looping through gully towards third man
bangs this in short, Ramdin has a waft and misses, though Buttler enquires if he might have tickled it
throws the bat, he's got to now, gets a thick outside edge and the ball diverts wide of Buttler, through first slip and away for a boundary
swing hard and lands another! This was slightly less ungainly, an agricultural heave over cover... very nearly went all the way. Modern bats, eh?
comes forward and squirts the ball towards point
sits in the crease and defends with an open bat face square on the off side

takes on the short ball... and dropped this time, Stokes again, though it would have been an even more spectacular take, just a inch or two above the turf. In fact, looks like he had it until his hand hit the turf and popped it out
cross-batted swat down the ground to long-on
pitched up and Miller pushes into the covers coming forwards
West Indies are living on the edge - literally in this case, as Miller gets enough on a stiff-armed swipe to send it over Buttler's grasp and away for another boundary
on the stumps, worked short on the leg side
tossed up on leg stump, Ramdin wanders out and glances one through midwicket
steps away and manages to skew a single to short third man
slices a cut and dropped again, Broad managing to reach above his head backpedalling from cover point but can't cling on to it!
flat and on the stumps, nurdles one more to the leg side
comes forward and flicks past midwicket, just one as the fielder runs in
darted in towards the stumps, nudges one down the ground
tossed up, clips the outer half of the bat and rolls towards point
goes back and across and pokes in front of backward point, gets Ramdin back on strike
in the slot and Ramdin cashes in, slamming six over deep midwicket! Down on one knee and crashes the arms through a meaty slog-sweep
uses the feet and works into a gap on the leg side, deep midwicket has to come in and they scamper a second

sweeps hard across the line again, this looks more like a top edge... but it sails metres beyond the boundary, another maximum! Ramdin brings up his maiden ODI ton - the second of the day - and West Indies can continue to dream
goes back and tries to glides one past short third man, can't get it through
goes back dabs at the ball, misses - another dot
on leg stump, defended
tossed up on leg stump, nurdled behind square on the leg side, Miller manages to steal one
Ramdin goes big again, a clean strike back over the bowler's head for six more! Turns a superb over into merely an okay one

Miller's luck runs out, heaves across the line, top-edging to short extra cover! Bresnan landed this back of a length on the stumps, Miller tried to do too much, when he really just needed to get Ramdin back on strike
on the stumps, good length and pulled flat through midwicket for a couple
pitched up outside off, swings across the line and gets one towards mid-on
short of a length and fired across the bows, defended on the back foot
steps away and throws the bat, slices high out towards backward point but lands safely
full and straight... too straight, as Ramdin gets a splinter of inside edge on it, diverts it off his pads for four to long leg! Again the lid just won't remain on
back of a length, outside off, opens the face towards point, Ramdin sends him back
drops short, at the body, pulled flat through midwicket for a couple

round the wicket, length ball slanted back in at the left-handed Narine... and he has picked this up and deposited it into the stands a deep midwicket! An easy swing of the arms from Narine, easily clearing the fence. Broad's brow furrows a little further
over the wicket, gets the full bunger on target, Narine manages to keep it out and they hustle one regardless

superb work from Broad and Narine is run out at the non-striker's end! England need just one more wicket (though remember how that turned out in Brisbane a few weeks ago?), Narine was backing up a long way only for Ramdin's pull to go straight to Chris Jordan, the substitute fielding at mid-on, his throw was good but it required Broad to grab it on the bounce and swing his arms back to flick off the bails as he passed the stumps. Dexterous stuff... West Indies now clinging on by a fingertip
goes across outside off and dabs one in front of point to keep the strike
length ball on the stumps... launched into the stands again by Ramdin, a viscous club over long-on. Still they believe!
pulled through square leg this time, Bresnan dropping short and Ramdin swivelling to clout the ball between two men on the fence!
and there's another boundary, Ramdin is going for broke! Spots the slower ball from Bresnan and uppercuts it over point, clears the fielder and just a couple of bounces to the rope

bowled him, Bresnan squeezes the yorker past Ramdin! Leg stump is out of the ground, Ramdin is flat on the metaphorical canvas, England have won! Bresnan is engulfed by his team-mates, he held his nerve after being taken for three consecutive boundaries... Ramdin stepped away, Bresnan went full and straight and though the bat came down, all he could do was deflect the ball on to the wicket. As heartbeats begin to return to normal, England have won by 25 runs and take the series 2-1
